trans-unit.source: Represents a 3-D rectangle: for example, a cube.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> is defined as a location (<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D>) and a size structure (<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D>).

Because the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D.X%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D.Y%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D.Z%2A> values specified for the size are magnitudes and not coordinates, they cannot be negative except in the case of an empty rectangle.

An empty rectangle is specified by <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D.Empty%2A>, which has <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D.X%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D.Y%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D.Z%2A> values of -Infinity.
This structure is typically used to represent the bounds of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D>.

<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> are not typically used in XAML, because no settable properties exist in the WPF 3D object model that use those types.
XAML Text Usage
Initializes a new instance of a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> structure.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> is typically used to represent the bounds of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D>.
Location of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref>.
Size of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> structure.
X-axis coordinate of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref>.
Y-axis coordinate of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref>.
Z-axis coordinate of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref>.
Size of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> in the X dimension.
Size of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> in the Y dimension.
Size of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> in the Z dimension.
Gets a value that indicates whether a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> is within the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref>, including its edges.
Rect3D is typically used to represent the bounds of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D>.
Point to be tested.
True if the specified point or rectangle is within the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref>, including its edges; false otherwise.
Gets a value that indicates whether a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> is within the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref>, including its edges.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> is typically used to represent the bounds of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D>.
<xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> to be tested.
True if the specified point or rectangle is within the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref>, including its edges; false otherwise.
Gets a value that indicates whether a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> is within the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref>, including its edges.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> is typically used to represent the bounds of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D>.
X-axis coordinate of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> to be tested.
Y-axis coordinate of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> to be tested.
Z-coordinate of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> to be tested.
`true` if the specified point or rectangle is within the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref>, including its edges; `false` otherwise.
Gets an empty <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref>.
This property returns an empty <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> whose X, Y, and Z values are positive-infinity and whose size values are negative infinity.
This is the only situation in which size values can be negative.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> is typically used to represent the bounds of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D>.
An empty <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref>.
Compares two <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> instances for equality.
Note that values of type <xref:System.Double> might acquire error when operated upon; an exact comparison between two logically-equal <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> values might fail.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> is typically used to represent the bounds of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D>.
The object to compare.
`true` if the two specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> instances are exactly equal; `false` otherwise.
Compares two <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> instances for equality.
Note that values of type <xref:System.Double> might acquire error when operated upon; an exact comparison between two logically-equal <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> values might fail.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> is typically used to represent the bounds of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> instance to compare with the current instance.
`true` if the two specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> instances are exactly equal; `false` otherwise.
Compares two <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> instances for equality.
Note that values of type <xref:System.Double> might acquire error when operated upon; an exact comparison between two logically-equal <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> values might fail.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> s typically used to represent the bounds of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D>.
First <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> to compare.
Second <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> to compare.
`true` if the two specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> instances are exactly equal; `false` otherwise.
Returns the hash code for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref>
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> is typically used to represent the bounds of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D>.
A hash code for this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref>.

Finds the intersection of the current <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> and the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref>, and stores the result as the current <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref>.
If the value of either specified rectangle is empty, this method returns an empty value.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> is typically used to represent the bounds of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> to intersect with the current <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref>.
Returns the intersection of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> values.
If the value of either specified rectangle is empty, this method returns an empty value.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> is typically used to represent the bounds of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D>.
First <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref>.
Second <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref>.
Result of the intersection of rect1 and rect2.
Returns a value that indicates whether the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> intersects with this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref>.
If one edge of each <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> is coincident, it is considered an intersection.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> is typically used to represent the bounds of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D>.
Rectangle to evaluate.
`true` if the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> intersects with this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref>; `false` otherwise.

Gets a value that indicates whether this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> is the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D.Empty"></xref><xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref>.

If <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D.Size%2A> is zero, this <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> still contains a zero- or 1-dimensional set of points; therefore, this property should not be used to check for zero area.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> is typically used to represent the bounds of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D>.
`true` if this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> is the empty rectangle; `false` otherwise.
Gets or sets a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> that represents the origin of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref>.
Note that in the 3-D coordinate system, the positive Y axis points up (assuming that the camera's <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.ProjectionCamera.UpDirection%2A> property is positive).
Therefore, this property usually represents the back bottom left corner of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> in the scene.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> is typically used to represent the bounds of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D>.

<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> are not typically used in XAML, because no settable properties exist in the WPF 3D object model that use those types.
XAML Text Usage
<xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> that represents the origin of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref>, typically the back bottom left corner.
The default value is (0,0,0).
Gets or sets an offset value by which the location of a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> is translated.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> is typically used to represent the bounds of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D>.
Rect3D to be translated.
Offset along the X axis.
Offset along the Y axis.
Offset along the Z axis.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> value that represents the result of the offset.
Gets or sets an offset value by which the location of a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> is translated.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> is typically used to represent the bounds of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D>.

Note that calling the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D.Offset%2A> method will only have an effect if you can change the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D.X%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D.Y%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D.Z%2A> properties directly.

Because <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> is a value type, if you reference a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> object by using a property or indexer, you get a copy of the object, not a reference to the object.

If you attempt to change <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D.X%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D.Y%2A>, or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D.Z%2A> on a property or indexer reference, a compiler error occurs.
Similarly, calling <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D.Offset%2A> on the property or indexer will not change the underlying object.

If you want to change the value of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> that is referenced as a property or indexer, create a new <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D>, modify its fields, and then assign the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> back to the property or indexer.
Offset along the X axis.
Offset along the Y axis.
Offset along the Z axis.
Sets the offset translation of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> to the provided value, specified as a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D"></xref>.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> is typically used to represent the bounds of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D>.

Note that calling the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D.Offset%2A> method will only have an effect if you can change the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D.X%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D.Y%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D.Z%2A> properties directly.

Because <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> is a value type, if you reference a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> object by using a property or indexer, you get a copy of the object, not a reference to the object.

If you attempt to change <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D.X%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D.Y%2A>, or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D.Z%2A> on a property or indexer reference, a compiler error occurs.
Similarly, calling <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D.Offset%2A> on the property or indexer will not change the underlying object.

If you want to change the value of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> that is referenced as a property or indexer, create a new <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D>, modify its fields, and then assign the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> back to the property or indexer.
<xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D"></xref> that specifies the offset translation.
Gets or sets an offset value by which the location of a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> is translated.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> is typically used to represent the bounds of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D>.
<xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> to be translated.
<xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D"></xref> that specifies the offset translation.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> value that represents the result of the offset.
Compares two <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> instances for exact equality.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> is typically used to represent the bounds of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D>.
First <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> to evaluate.
Second <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> to evaluate.
`true` if the two <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> instances are exactly equal; `false` otherwise.
Compares two <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> instances for exact inequality.
Note that <xref:System.Double> values can acquire error when operated upon; an exact comparison between two <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> values which are logically equal might fail.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> is typically used to represent the bounds of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D>.
First <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> to compare.
Second <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> to compare.
True if the two <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> instances are unequal, false otherwise.
Converts a string representation of a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> into the equivalent <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> structure.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> is typically used to represent the bounds of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D>.
String that represents a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref>.
A string representation of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref>.
Gets or sets the area of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref>.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> is typically used to represent the bounds of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D>.

<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> are not typically used in XAML, because no settable properties exist in the WPF 3D object model that use those types.
XAML Text Usage
<xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D"></xref> that specifies the area of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref>.
Gets or sets the size of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> in the X dimension.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> is typically used to represent the bounds of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D>.

<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> are not typically used in XAML, because no settable properties exist in the WPF 3D object model that use those types.
XAML Text Usage
Double that specifies the size of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> in the X dimension.
Gets or sets the size of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> in the Y dimension.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> is typically used to represent the bounds of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D>.

<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> are not typically used in XAML, because no settable properties exist in the WPF 3D object model that use those types.
XAML Text Usage
Double that specifies the size of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> in the Y dimension.
Gets or sets the size of the Rect3D in the Z dimension.
Rect3D is typically used to represent the bounds of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D>.

<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> are not typically used in XAML, because no settable properties exist in the WPF 3D object model that use those types.
XAML Text Usage
Double that specifies the size of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> in the Z dimension.
Creates a string representation of the Rect3D.
A string representation of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref>.
Creates a string representation of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref>.
Culture-specific formatting information.
A string representation of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref>.
Returns a new instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> that represents the union of two <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> objects.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> is typically used to represent the bounds of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D>.
First <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref>.
Second <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref>.
A value that represents the result of the union of rect1 and rect2.

Updates a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> to reflect the union of that <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> and a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref>.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> is typically used to represent the bounds of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> whose union with the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> is to be evaluated.

Updates a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> to reflect the union of that <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> and a second specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref>.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> is typically used to represent the bounds of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> whose union with the current <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> is to be evaluated.

Returns a new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> that represents the union of a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref>, and a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref>.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> is typically used to represent the bounds of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> whose union with the current <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> is to be evaluated.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> whose union with the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> is to be evaluated.
Result of the union of rect and point.
Gets or sets the value of the X coordinate of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref>.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> is typically used to represent the bounds of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D>.

<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> are not typically used in XAML, because no settable properties exist in the WPF 3D object model that use those types.
XAML Text Usage
Value of the X coordinate of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref>.
Gets or sets the value of the Y coordinate of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref>.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> is typically used to represent the bounds of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D>.

XAML Text Usage
Value of the Y coordinate of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref>.
Gets or sets the value of the Z coordinate of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref>.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> is typically used to represent the bounds of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D>.

<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> are not typically used in XAML, because no settable properties exist in the WPF 3D object model that use those types.
XAML Text Usage
Value of the Z coordinate of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref>.
This member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.IFormattable.ToString(System.String,System.IFormatProvider)"></xref>.
The string specifying the format to use.
-or-
`null` to use the default format defined for the type of the <xref href="System.IFormattable"></xref> implementation.
The `IFormatProvider` to use to format the value.
-or-
`null` to obtain the numeric format information from the current locale setting of the operating system.
A string containing the value of the current instance in the specified format.
